intro: Felicia rigidula var. subcanescens, commonly known as the silverleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and yellow daisy-like flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is drought-tolerant, making it well adapted to arid environments. It has a compact growth habit and is often used in rock gardens or as a ornamental plant. The species is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with composite flower heads.
